story.description:
X Create new ELB: "autocomplete-external" X Add instances to it. XSubmit DNS change request for autocomplete.demandbase.com X Verify DNS is updated X Verify nobody is using picker.demandbase.com X Remove old ELB X Submit request to remove picker.demandbase.com from DNS
Commands:
elb-create-lb autocomplete-external --availability-zones us-east-1b --listener "protocol=HTTP,lb-port=80,instance-port=80" --listener "protocol=TCP,lb-port=443,instance-port=443"
elb-register-instances-with-lb --lb autocomplete-external --instances i-f0ef0a9d, i-4afd1827
elb-describe-instance-health autocomplete-external
story.name: Rename picker-external ELB to more closely match AutoComplete branding

story.description:

story.name: Reenable service on new master

story.description: * stopping slave replication everywhere * stop all services on master that do write ** disable resque worker * rsync data to new * verify MySQL working on new master
story.name: Migrate data from live master to new master

note.text: # @currentmaster flush tables and write lock echo "flush tables; lock table write lock;" | mysql
note.author: Matt Todd

note.text: # @slaves disable replication echo "stop slave;" | mysql
note.author: Matt Todd

note.text:
IGNORE ABOVE FLUSH TABLES:
# @newmaster disable resque worker (mysql writes) vim /etc/crontab # resque_worker_lifeline kill -9 $RESQUE_PID
# @currentmaster & @newmaster stop mysql /etc/init.d/mysql stop
# @newmaster rsync over data dir rsync -avz root@10.201.191.63:/db/ /db/
# @newmaster start MySQL /etc/init.d/mysql start
# @newmaster set root password correctly echo "SET PASSWORD=PASSWORD('H_eBV2Oc5QT9ghzINIwp');" | mysql # look up password from /etc/mysql/my.cnf
note.author: Matt Todd

note.text:
# reconfigure and restart replication due to minor misconfiguration in chef
export pw=... mysql -u root -p$pw < /etc/mysql/grants.sql echo "stop slave; change master to master_host='';" | mysql -u root -p$pw chef-client
screen /etc/mysql/setup_replication.sh
note.author: Matt Todd

story.description:
When Martin put in his email address, the domain in the search for v1.6 affected the results oddly so that 7-11 and others showed up and ignored the search terms
Search data: mlongo@demandbase.com cisco 69.38.209.30
[Thu Oct 7 19:05:25.430 2010] 0.605 sec [ext/2/rel 721024 (0,10)] [company_picker_core] (@(company,marketing_alias) ^Demand*) | (@lead_company ^3415304$) | (@domain_string demandbase.com) | ((@state ^CA$))
should group the term with the state
story.name: Domain in AutoComplete is influencing the results abnormally

note.text:
The Google API v3 does not require a key anymore as can be seen from: http://maps.google.com/maps/geo?q=Atlanta&output=xml&key=&oe=utf-8
The Geokit RubyGem should be able to work without modification.
The Yahoo PlaceFinder API doesn't either but GeoKit doesn't support this newer API.

story.description:
When someone logs in, look up the current DemandbaseOrganization and CompanyPicker records for their IP.
If it doesn't exist, prompt them to create it with the IP already populated.
If it does, show them the current information and ask them if it's correct, providing a link to edit it if it isn't.

story.description:
Can reproduce issue here:
http://autocomplete.demandbase.com/autocomplete?version=v1.6&term=Demand&state=TX
Specifically, "Demand" should show more than just the 3 Demand companies in Texas, including potentially Demandbase.
story.name: Autocomplete v1.6 results seem to filter on state instead of just boosting

note.text:
The issue was that when State was available it was doing an AND without allowing just the term to also pull up results without a state.
Effectively, we now do: (term and state) or term

Matt Todd: "Demandbase Sonoa Integration Followup"
ELB/EC2 Setup
http://awsdocs.s3.amazonaws.com/ElasticLoadBalancing/latest/elb-qrc.pdf elb-create-lb api-slaves-staging --availability-zones us-east-1b --listener "protocol=HTTP,lb-port=80,instance-port=80" --listener "protocol=TCP,lb-port=443,instance-port=443" https://highgroove.basecamphq.com/projects/3131806/posts/34242241/comments
Access Key ID: 1YHWRHEWC681Q79V3RR2 Secret Key: AJCxAPm3DtebAkJDhOeDcRPP6ApWn5moxlfL0pDT certs : ~/Documents/ec2/keys/demandbase-*
ELB | DNS ------------------------------------- api-internal -> apps | api.demandbase.com (http/https) - api-internal-504169344.us-east-1.elb.amazonaws.com (instances from api-slaves) - READY api-external ->sonoa | filter.api.demandbase.com (http/https) - api-external-1622197513.us-east-1.elb.amazonaws.com (instances from sonoa-sn-production) - READY picker-external -> apps | picker.demandbase.com (http/https) - picker-external-1870574169.us-east-1.elb.amazonaws.com (instances from picker-slaves) - READY api-stage-internal -> apps | stage.api.demandbase.com (http/https) - api-stage-internal-414170766.us-east-1.elb.amazonaws.com (instances from demandbase-api-slaves-staging) -> READY api-stage-external -> sonoa | stage.filter.api.demandbase.com (http/https) - api-stage-external-1967497430.us-east-1.elb.amazonaws.com (instances from api-slaves-staging-sonoa) -> READY
non-elb: ---------------------------- api-admin.demandbase.com stage.api-admin.demandbase.com
SONOA go live: 1. change api.demandbase.com to CNAME to api-external 2. change stage.api.demandbase.com to CNAME to api-stage-external
Rampradeep - per key policies (policies apply to many keys, but are enforced per key and not per policy)Rampradeep Krishnamurthy: "RE: Demandbase Sonoa Integration Followup"
